description: From Ancient Greek ὀσμή (osmḗ, “smell”) (because of the strong smell of its oxide)  +‎ -ium.

entries.meaning: A chemical element (symbol Os) with atomic number 76: a hard, brittle, heavy, bluish-white transition metal found as a trace element in alloys, mostly in platinum ores.
(countable) A single atom of this element.
